dialogue: Hey Shelly.
You got my message! Oh it’s so good to see you! Oh my goodness! What are you doing here??
Not that I’m-- you know, you can show up on my doorstep any time, any day, anytime, I just-- I’m just so glad you’re here!
Why aren’t you at school?
I had to come home for Lisa’s birthday so--
Oh, it’s Lisa’s birthday! I’ll have to send her a card, or call--
You don’t have to do that--
No, I will, I want to. How’s she? How are she and Jeff?
They’re really good. I’m graduating in May--
I know! Oh hon, you’re graduating so soon, I just-- oh I can’t believe it!
And Becky’s graduating too so we’re gonna do like, a joint party--
Oh Becky’s graduating too! Oh that’s so good-- good for her, good for Becky!
Yeah, it’s a lot of family time, so I wanted to get out of the house anyway...
...You look so beautiful, honey.
Noooo...
You do. You look so beautiful, so grown up. I just can’t believe I haven’t seen you in what, a year?
Yeah... A moment.
So... do you have a boyfriend?
No, just trying to focus on getting out of school.
Okay. Oh well. ...Plenty of time for boyfriends! You know, later. It’s awkward.
Have you declared a major?
I’m studying photography.
Oh that’s so exciting--!
Thanks. Lisa said it wouldn’t be that useful to have any kind of art degree but... it’s the only thing I really care about so...
Well I think it’s brilliant that you’re doing that. Being part of a creative community, it’s the best.
It’s pretty solitary, it’s not really a community.
Well being an artist is solitary. But if you’re passionate about it, it’s worth it.
You know what...? I should get going...
Oh no-- I was just about to say that you should stay for dinner--
I just wanted to drop by and say hello-- I have to get-- have to get home for dinner...
You could just call them and say you’re eating with me tonight, couldn’t you? It’s just one night.
I dunno, Becky just got home...
Lisa wouldn’t mind, would she? Just one dinner-- just one night?
I really can’t, Shelly.
I was thinking, that since the show is closing, I could probably get a couple days off and come visit you in Tucson.
What?
Oh the show-- it’s closing. Can’t talk about it too much, I’ll just dissolve into tears. But you know I’ll finally have some time to maybe come visit. Could come to your graduation. If you want.
...I’ll think about it.
Okay. Come here, give your mom a hug.
You know, if you ever want to come see the show--
What?
Sorry, I didn’t mean￾
It’s just so good to see you I was just... trying to figure out how to see you again soon. Little misstep...
It’s okay. ...See you, Shelly.
You’d think they could get our set in place before our call time, so we can warm up like normal, you know? They’ve got every guy on our crew out there--
I just thought we could have that dinner.
So, what’s the plan after graduation?
I think maybe I’ll save some more money and then, I dunno... I kind of want to just travel around. I really want to go to Europe but...
Oh wow, that would be amazing. You’ve gotta do that.
It’s just expensive. And being a photographer is just... it’s hard.
What??
It’s a hard career path.
Says who??
Like, everybody.
Yeah but did someone say “Oh that’s hard. Being an artist, that’s really hard.” Did someone put that dumb sentence into your head?
Um yeah, Lisa, for one. That’s what parents do when they want you to get a job that like, pays money.

Well, she’s not your actual parent, she may think she is, but working at a job that you don’t really love, that’s hard. When you know your calling is out there waiting for you. Money doesn’t make a boring job that much better. What does Lisa want you to do?
She thinks I’d be great at like, graphic design.
Does that interest you right now?
No.
Then forget about it!
I’ll meet you in Paris.
Oh my god, what was that?
What?
I just saw something scurry across the floor.
Are you sure? What, like a mouse??
Yes! There it is again!!
What!!
They live in the hidey-holes the gangsters who lived here before me used to keep their money in! I wish I knew where it was!
There it is again!!
Oh! Hey sweetie, oh my gosh.
I saw the show tonight.
Oh, you did. That’s so sweet, that means a lot to me that you came.
I wasn’t sure if I was even gonna tell you... there was barely anyone there.

Yeah, that was maybe the worst house we’ve ever had in the history of the whole entire show. There were only what, like eighteen people out there? If I’d’ve known you were here I would have done a special little shout out or point or something--
Yeah, it’s okay.
I thought you were just going back to the Kelly’s... So, what’d you think?
I think I thought it would be different...
Oh yeah...?
Yeah, like harder dancing or something...?
Oh, we just make it look easy--
...It’s kinda just a stupid nudie show...
It’s a classic spectacle with-- with dancing nudes, but it’s certainly not a “nudie show.”
“Dancing nudes?” Is that like, a technical term?
Yes. Yes, it is.

What is the point of that show? What was that? And why did you invite me? Maybe you thought I wouldn’t come? Or I don’t know-- I don’t know why I did come-- although I guess it’s because I just hoped-- I just wanted to know that it was worth it. That it was better than me after all.
What??
That you didn’t put this lame trash above me--
It’s not-- I disagree-- and plus, I didn’t put anything above you. I provided for you--
I keep forgetting that you’re not actually a reasonable person: that you left me in the casino parking lot with a Gameboy while you did two shows a night.
I didn’t think it was appropriate for you backstage--
It wasn’t!!
I couldn’t afford help, Hannah--
You are so lucky that when Lisa saw me in the car, she didn’t turn me in to child services.
I-- I-- was doing my best, I know-- I was just doing my best, Hannah-- if you can actually do what you love for thirty years, if you are fortunate enough to be passionate about your career--
Career?!! What kind of career is this?? You’re in the goddamn back of 80 topless dancers! This was worth missing bedtime for most of my childhood?? ...Was it?
See, this is why I came tonight. I always wanted to see a reason in all of this and tonight I finally didn’t.
Shelly--

I’m so sorry, Hannah. I am so sorry that you didn’t get what you wanted from me. If you can forgive me? Anytime? Anytime in your life? I would love that. But I can’t defend myself anymore, I just can’t.
Hey-- I’m still here--
